    AR1 Transformer Function

    AR1_transform.Rd

    The transformer function takes a bamlss.frame object and transforms the response and the design matrices to account for lag 1 autocorrelation. The method is also known as Prais-Winsten estimation.

    trans_AR1(rho = 0.1)
AR1(rho = 0.1)

    Arguments

    rho

    Specifies the correlation parameter at lag 1.

    Value

    A transformer function which can be used in the bamlss call.

    References

    Johnston, John (1972). Econometric Methods (2nd ed.). New York: McGraw-Hill. pp. 259--265.

    See also

    bamlss.frame, bamlss, smooth2random.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) ## Simulate AR1 data.
set.seed(111)

n <- 240
d <- data.frame("t" = 1:n)

## Nonlinear function.
f <- function(x) {
  2 + sin(x / n * 2 * pi - pi)
}

## Correlated errors.
rho <- 0.8
e <- rnorm(n, sd = 0.1)
u <- c(e[1], rep(NA, n - 1))
for(i in 2:n){
  u[i] <- rho * u[i - 1] + e[i]
}

## Response.
d$y <- f(d$t) + u

## Plot time-series data.
plot(d, type = "l")

## Estimate models without and with AR1 transformation.
b0 <- bamlss(y ~ s(t,k=20), data = d, criterion = "BIC")
#> BIC 154.3940 logPost -107.284 logLik -53.5464 edf 8.6306 eps 0.4110 iteration   1
#> BIC -16.7269 logPost -21.7241 logLik  32.0140 edf 8.6306 eps 0.1842 iteration   2
#> BIC -119.934 logPost  39.0311 logLik  84.7677 edf 9.0502 eps 0.1175 iteration   3
#> BIC -183.052 logPost  69.7191 logLik 127.2920 edf 13.051 eps 0.0863 iteration   4
#> BIC -211.769 logPost  83.0572 logLik 153.1001 edf 17.229 eps 0.0532 iteration   5
#> BIC -215.066 logPost  84.6847 logLik 158.1686 edf 18.477 eps 0.0169 iteration   6
#> BIC -215.193 logPost  84.7711 logLik 159.0422 edf 18.773 eps 0.0024 iteration   7
#> BIC -215.194 logPost  84.7751 logLik 159.1362 edf 18.807 eps 0.0001 iteration   8
#> BIC -215.194 logPost  84.7753 logLik 159.1418 edf 18.809 eps 0.0000 iteration   9
#> BIC -215.194 logPost  84.7753 logLik 159.1418 edf 18.809 eps 0.0000 iteration   9
#> elapsed time:  0.70sec
#> Starting the sampler...
#> 
#> |                    |   0% 16.18sec
#> |*                   |   5% 15.68sec  0.83sec
#> |**                  |  10% 13.82sec  1.54sec
#> |***                 |  15% 11.83sec  2.09sec
#> |****                |  20% 11.27sec  2.82sec
#> |*****               |  25% 10.46sec  3.49sec
#> |******              |  30%  9.91sec  4.25sec
#> |*******             |  35%  9.40sec  5.06sec
#> |********            |  40%  8.78sec  5.85sec
#> |*********           |  45%  7.71sec  6.31sec
#> |**********          |  50%  6.82sec  6.82sec
#> |***********         |  55%  5.96sec  7.28sec
#> |************        |  60%  5.19sec  7.78sec
#> |*************       |  65%  4.41sec  8.19sec
#> |**************      |  70%  3.84sec  8.95sec
#> |***************     |  75%  3.30sec  9.89sec
#> |****************    |  80%  2.68sec 10.72sec
#> |*****************   |  85%  2.02sec 11.47sec
#> |******************  |  90%  1.34sec 12.08sec
#> |******************* |  95%  0.67sec 12.76sec
#> |********************| 100%  0.00sec 13.42sec
b1 <- bamlss(y ~ s(t,k=20), data = d, criterion = "BIC",
  transform = AR1(rho = 0.8))
#> BIC 109.3765 logPost -96.0687 logLik -14.5577 edf 14.644 eps 0.4214 iteration   1
#> BIC -191.426 logPost  58.2571 logLik 116.0941 edf 7.4375 eps 0.1789 iteration   2
#> BIC -321.071 logPost 123.0799 logLik 180.9170 edf 7.4375 eps 0.1038 iteration   3
#> BIC -374.725 logPost 149.9067 logLik 207.7438 edf 7.4375 eps 0.0630 iteration   4
#> BIC -382.513 logPost 153.8009 logLik 211.6380 edf 7.4375 eps 0.0253 iteration   5
#> BIC -382.712 logPost 168.0001 logLik 212.2694 edf 7.6316 eps 0.0058 iteration   6
#> BIC -382.713 logPost 168.0003 logLik 212.2696 edf 7.6316 eps 0.0002 iteration   7
#> BIC -382.713 logPost 168.0003 logLik 212.2696 edf 7.6316 eps 0.0000 iteration   8
#> BIC -382.713 logPost 168.0003 logLik 212.2696 edf 7.6316 eps 0.0000 iteration   8
#> elapsed time:  1.28sec
#> Starting the sampler...
#> 
#> |                    |   0%  9.16sec
#> |*                   |   5% 13.74sec  0.72sec
#> |**                  |  10% 11.40sec  1.27sec
#> |***                 |  15% 10.21sec  1.80sec
#> |****                |  20%  8.98sec  2.25sec
#> |*****               |  25%  8.24sec  2.75sec
#> |******              |  30%  7.97sec  3.41sec
#> |*******             |  35%  7.73sec  4.16sec
#> |********            |  40%  7.41sec  4.94sec
#> |*********           |  45%  7.05sec  5.77sec
#> |**********          |  50%  6.53sec  6.53sec
#> |***********         |  55%  5.92sec  7.23sec
#> |************        |  60%  5.20sec  7.80sec
#> |*************       |  65%  4.46sec  8.28sec
#> |**************      |  70%  3.77sec  8.81sec
#> |***************     |  75%  3.13sec  9.40sec
#> |****************    |  80%  2.49sec  9.95sec
#> |*****************   |  85%  1.86sec 10.55sec
#> |******************  |  90%  1.24sec 11.17sec
#> |******************* |  95%  0.62sec 11.69sec
#> |********************| 100%  0.00sec 12.17sec

## Estimate full AR1 model.
b2 <- bamlss(y ~ s(t,k=20), data = d, criterion = "BIC",
  family = "AR1")
#> BIC 143.1020 logPost -106.724 logLik -45.1601 edf 9.6306 eps 0.6073 iteration   1
#> BIC -67.3779 logPost  -1.4850 logLik  60.0799 edf 9.6306 eps 0.1764 iteration   2
#> BIC -236.858 logPost  83.2551 logLik 144.8199 edf 9.6306 eps 0.1082 iteration   3
#> BIC -334.207 logPost 131.9297 logLik 193.4945 edf 9.6306 eps 0.0687 iteration   4
#> BIC -360.309 logPost 144.9808 logLik 206.5457 edf 9.6306 eps 0.0361 iteration   5
#> BIC -346.447 logPost 152.7244 logLik 207.9081 edf 12.657 eps 0.0116 iteration   6
#> BIC -346.465 logPost 152.7336 logLik 207.9172 edf 12.657 eps 0.0020 iteration   7
#> BIC -346.471 logPost 152.7366 logLik 207.9202 edf 12.657 eps 0.0009 iteration   8
#> BIC -346.474 logPost 152.7383 logLik 207.9219 edf 12.657 eps 0.0005 iteration   9
#> BIC -346.477 logPost 152.7394 logLik 207.9231 edf 12.657 eps 0.0003 iteration  10
#> BIC -346.478 logPost 152.7402 logLik 207.9239 edf 12.657 eps 0.0001 iteration  11
#> BIC -346.479 logPost 152.7408 logLik 207.9245 edf 12.657 eps 0.0001 iteration  12
#> BIC -346.479 logPost 152.7408 logLik 207.9245 edf 12.657 eps 0.0001 iteration  12
#> elapsed time:  1.18sec
#> Starting the sampler...
#> 
#> |                    |   0% 15.71sec
#> |*                   |   5% 13.02sec  0.69sec
#> |**                  |  10% 11.22sec  1.25sec
#> |***                 |  15% 10.57sec  1.87sec
#> |****                |  20% 10.52sec  2.63sec
#> |*****               |  25% 10.31sec  3.44sec
#> |******              |  30%  9.69sec  4.15sec
#> |*******             |  35%  9.71sec  5.23sec
#> |********            |  40%  9.23sec  6.16sec
#> |*********           |  45%  8.53sec  6.98sec
#> |**********          |  50%  7.77sec  7.77sec
#> |***********         |  55%  6.93sec  8.47sec
#> |************        |  60%  6.23sec  9.35sec
#> |*************       |  65%  5.69sec 10.58sec
#> |**************      |  70%  4.97sec 11.61sec
#> |***************     |  75%  4.19sec 12.58sec
#> |****************    |  80%  3.36sec 13.46sec
#> |*****************   |  85%  2.49sec 14.10sec
#> |******************  |  90%  1.65sec 14.88sec
#> |******************* |  95%  0.85sec 16.15sec
#> |********************| 100%  0.00sec 17.08sec
rho <- predict(b2, model = "rho", type = "parameter")
print(range(rho))
#> [1] 0.8085952 0.8085952

## Estimated standard deviations.
sd0 <- predict(b0, model = "sigma", type = "parameter")
sd1 <- predict(b1, model = "sigma", type = "parameter")
sd2 <- predict(b2, model = "sigma", type = "parameter")
print(round(c(sd0[1], sd1[1], sd2[1]), 2))
#> [1] 0.13 0.00 0.10

## Plot fitted trends.
p0 <- predict(b0, model = "mu")
p1 <- predict(b1, model = "mu")
p2 <- predict(b2, model = "mu")

plot(d, type = "l")
lines(f(d$t) ~ d$t, col = 2, lwd = 2)
lines(p0 ~ d$t, col = 4, lwd = 2)
lines(p1 ~ d$t, col = 3, lwd = 3)
lines(p2 ~ d$t, col = 5, lwd = 3)
legend("topleft",
  c("no trans", "with trans", "AR1 model", "truth"),
  lwd = 2, col = c(4, 3, 5, 2), bty = "n")
